title: Montreal Classification for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
description: Classifies phenotype and severity of Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis to guide treatment decisions and predict disease course.

formula: For Crohn's Disease: A[age] + L[location] + B[behavior] + p[perianal]. For Ulcerative Colitis: A[age] + E[extent] + S[severity]. Age: A1 (<17y), A2 (17-40y), A3 (>40y).
notes: Montreal Classification replaced Vienna Classification in 2005
Provides standardized phenotypic characterization for IBD
Age categories: A1 (<17 years), A2 (17-40 years), A3 (>40 years)
Crohn's location: L1 (ileal), L2 (colonic), L3 (ileocolonic), L4 (upper GI)
Perianal modifier 'p' can be added to any Crohn's behavior
UC severity: S0 (remission), S1 (mild), S2 (moderate), S3 (severe)
Classification evolves over time with disease progression
Helps predict prognosis and guide treatment strategies
Widely used in clinical trials and research
